CTR.Q: What type of chart is this?

VEC.Q: How many stages are there in this funnel chart?

SRP.Q: Is the Design Phase stage positioned above or below the Production stage?
SRP.A: The Design Phase stage is positioned {above} the Production stage.

VPR.Q: What pattern does the data reduction follow in this funnel chart?
VPR.A: The data reduction follows a {logarithmic} pattern.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Design Phase?
VE.A: The value of stage Design Phase is {64%}.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Final Design Approval?
VE.A: The value of stage Final Design Approval is {17%}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the highest value is Project Initiation, with a value of {100%}.

EVJ.Q: What is the minimum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the lowest value is Market Release, with a value of {12%}.

SC.Q: What is the percentage reduction from stage Prototype Development to stage Testing and Validation?
SC.A: The percentage reduction from stage Prototype Development to stage Testing and Validation is {15%}.

SC.Q: What is the percentage reduction from stage Final Design Approval to stage Production?
SC.A: The percentage reduction from stage Final Design Approval to stage Production is {2%}.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value exceed 53%? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Project Initiation} stage has {100%}, the {Design Phase} stage has {64%}.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall below 22%? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Final Design Approval} stage has {17%}, the {Production} stage has {15%}, the {Market Release} stage has {12%}.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall between 16% and 53%? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Prototype Development} stage has {43%}, the {Testing and Validation} stage has {28%}, the {Final Design Approval} stage has {17%}.

NC.Q: Which reduction is greater: from stage Testing and Validation to Final Design Approval, or from stage Design Phase to Prototype Development?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Design Phase} to {Prototype Development} is greater.

NC.Q: Which reduction is the greatest: from stage Project Initiation to Design Phase, from stage Prototype Development to Testing and Validation, or from stage Testing and Validation to Final Design Approval?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Project Initiation} to stage {Design Phase} is the greatest.

NC.Q: Which reduction is the greatest: from stage Final Design Approval to Production, from stage Design Phase to Prototype Development, or from stage Production to Market Release?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Design Phase} to stage {Prototype Development} is the greatest.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the largest?
MSR.A: The largest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Project Initiation} and {Design Phase} stages.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the smallest?
MSR.A: The smallest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Final Design Approval} and {Production} stages.
